1)Reflections on your computer screen as well as glare on walls and reflective surfaces cause CVS 
2) Install an anti-glare screen on your monitor 
3) Paint bright white walls a darker colour with a matte finish 
4) Cover the windows
1) Blinking moistens eyes & prevents dryness and irritation \n2) People blink less frequently while working at a computer

1).Every 20 minutes, blink 10 times by closing your eyes as if falling asleep - very slowly. This will help rewet your eyes. \n2).Look far away at an object for 10-15 seconds, then stare at something up close for 10-15 seconds. Then look back at the distant object. Do this 10 times. This exercise decreases the risk of your eyes focusing ability to lock up (accommodative spasm) after lengthy computer work

1) Reduce outdoor light by closing drapes or blinds \n2) Excessively bright light either from harsh interior lighting or sunlight coming in through a window can cause eye strain \n3) Position the computer monitor or screen so windows are to the side instead of in front or behind it
Drink at least one glass of water before each lecture
Keep a reusable water bottle with you
A simple way to increase your water intake is to make a habit of drinking at least one glass of water before each lecture
You can also set reminders to drink more water. These reminders can help you increase your water intake specially if you struggle with being forgetful or too busy to drink.

Keeping a water bottle with you throughout the day can help you drink more water. Keeping a water bottle handy can also serve as a visual reminder to drink more water. If you see the bottle on your desk or table you will constantly be reminded to drink more.

One way to drink more water and boost your health and reduce your calorie intake is to replace other drinks such as soda and sports drinks with water. \nThese drinks are often full of added sugars which can be extremely detrimental to your health.
